sen.j: 帷子ノ辻駅（かたびらのつじえき）は、京都市右京区太秦帷子ヶ辻町にある京福電気鉄道の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Uzumasa-katabiranotsuji-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Katabiranotsuji Station is a station of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd..
Katabiranotsuji Station, located in Uzumasa-katabiranotsuji-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a facility of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Katabiranotsuji Station, located in Uzumasa-katabiranotsuji-cho, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a facility of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 駅ナンバリングはA9（嵐山本線）、B1（北野線）。
sen.e: The station numbers are A8 (for the Arashiyama Main Line) and B1 (for the Kitano Line).
The station numbers are A8 (for the Arashiyama Main Line) and B1 (for the Kitano Line).
The station numbers are A8 (for the Arashiyama Main Line) and B1 (for the Kitano Line).

sen.j: 付近の地名は「太秦帷子ケ辻町」（うずまさかたびらのつじちょう 「かたびらがつじ」とは読まない）だが、駅名「帷子ノ辻」の表記には「ケ」ではなく「ノ」を用いる。
sen.e: The geographical mane of the area around the station is 太秦帷子ケ辻町 (the pronounciation of this name is Uzumasa-Katabiranotsuji-cho, not Uzumasa-Katabiragatsuji-cho), but, for the station name, 帷子ノ辻, which includes "ノ" instead of "ケ," is used.

The geographical name of the area around the station is 太秦帷子ケ辻町 (the pronounciation is Uzumasa-Katabiranotsuji-cho, not Uzumasa-Katabiragatsuji-cho), but for the station name 帷子ノ辻, which includes "ノ" instead of "ケ," is used.

The geographical name of the area around the station is 太秦帷子ケ辻町 (the pronunciation is Uzumasa-Katabiranotsuji-cho, not Uzumasa-Katabiragatsuji-cho), but for the station name 帷子ノ辻, which includes 'ノ' instead of 'ケ,' is used.
sen.cmt: "→ ' としました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式・島式ホーム各1面の計2面4線の地上駅。
sen.e: This station is located on the ground level, with a platform serving a track and an island platform serving three tracks.
sen.cmt: 相対式と島式ですと、3面になるように思いますが、後の方の記述も勘案しますと、訳に記しましたように、３トラック用の島式プラットホームと単式の１プラットホームからなっているのが実態のようですので、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: This station is located at ground level, with a platform serving a track and an island platform serving three tracks.
This station is located at ground level, with a platform serving a track and an island platform serving three tracks.

sen.j: 改札口が地下に設置されている地下駅舎方式であるが、地上にあるプラットホーム全体を建物が覆っているため、一見橋上駅舎のように見える。
sen.e: With the entrance/exit gate place located underground, the station house is a so-called underground station house, but at first glance, it looks like an over-track station house, because the entire area of the platforms on the ground level is placed within a building.

With the entrance/exit gate located underground, the station house is a so-called underground station house, but at first glance it looks like an over-track station house because the entire area of the platforms on the ground level is placed within a building.

With the ticket gate located underground, the station house is a so-called underground station house, but at first glance it looks like an over-track station house because the entire area of the platforms on the ground level is placed within a building.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: この建物は京福電鉄所有のビル「ランデンプラザ帷子」であり、中にスーパーマーケットの「フレスコ」や衣服の安売り店「オンセンド」や100円ショップ「大創産業」等がある。
sen.e: This building is "Randen Plaza Katabira" owned by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., where Fresco, a supermarket, On Sendo, a shop selling clothes at discount prices, and Daiso-Sangyo, a \100 store, are located.
This building is "Randen Plaza Katabira," owned by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., where Fresco, a supermarket, On Sendo, a discount clothing store, and Daiso-Sangyo, a \100 store, are located.
This building is 'Randen Plaza Katabira,' owned by Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., where Fresco, a supermarket, On Sendo, a discount clothing store, and Daiso-Sangyo, a \100 store, are located.

sen.j: 現在、ランデンプラザ帷子の南に接して存在したスーパーマーケット「京都厚生会」（ポロロッカ (企業)）の跡地は京都銀行帷子ノ辻支店となっている。
sen.e: The Katabiranotsuji Branch of Kyoto Bank is now located at the former site of the Kyoto Koseikai supermarket (operated by Pororoca Corporation), which existed in the immediate south side of Randen Plaza Katabira.

The Katabiranotsuji branch of Kyoto Bank is now located at the former site of the Kyoto Koseikai supermarket (operated by Pororoca Corporation), which existed in the immediate south side of Randen Plaza Katabira.

The Katabiranotsuji branch of Kyoto Bank is now located at the former site of the Kyoto Koseikai supermarket (operated by Pororoca Corporation), which existed in the immediate south side of Randen Plaza Katabira.

tit.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 地下に1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: Only one entrance/exit gate place is provided underground.
Only one entrance/exit gate is provided underground.
Only one ticket gate is provided underground.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 有人改札。
sen.e: The entrance/exit gate place is manned
The entrance/exit gate is manned.
The ticket gate is manned.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 改札前には花店がある。
sen.e: A flower shop is located in front of the entrance/exit gate place.
A flower shop is located in front of the entrance/exit gate.
A flower shop is located in front of the ticket gate.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 2番線と4番線の間に切り欠き式のホームの3番線があり、2～4番線は同一平面上で乗り換えできる。
sen.e: Part of the island platform placed between track 2 and track 4 is cut to accommodate another track, track 3 which is terminated here, and therefore, users can change trains on tracks 2 to 4 on the same plane.

Part of the island platform placed between track 2 and track 4 is cut to accommodate another track (track 3), which is terminated here, and consequently users can change trains on tracks 2 to 4 while remaining on the same plane.

Part of the island platform placed between Platform 2 and Platform 4 is cut to accommodate another platform (Platform 3), which is terminated here, and consequently users can change trains on Platforms 2 to 4 while remaining on the same plane.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1番線と他のホームの乗り換えには、階段で地下道を通る必要がある。
sen.e: However, to move between the platform for track 1 and the platform for other tracks, you must use an undeground path utilizing stairs.
However, to move between the platform for track 1 and the platform for other tracks, one must use an underground path by way of stairs.
However, to move between the Platform 1 and other platforms, one must use an underground path by way of stairs.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 北野線は通常は4番線を使用する。
sen.e: Trains on the Kitano Line use track 4 usually.
Trains on the Kitano Line most often use track 4.
Trains on the Kitano Line most often use Platform 4.
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: ただし、行楽期の昼間時間帯に運転される北野白梅町～嵐山直通列車は、配線の関係上、上下方向とも4番線発着となり、その間は北野線折り返し列車は3番線を使用する。
sen.e: However, in the the day time of the seasons when people enjoy outing, the through service trains, both inbound and outbound trains, operated between Kitano-hakubai-cho and Arashiyama arrive at and depart from track 4, and during the time, the trains returing from this station use track 3.

However, during daylight hours in seasons when people enjoy outings, the through-service trains (both inbound and outbound) operating between Kitano-hakubai-cho and Arashiyama arrive at and depart from track 4, and during that time the trains returning from this station use track 3.

However, during daylight hours in seasons when people enjoy outings, the through-service trains (both inbound and outbound) operating between Kitano-Hakubaicho and Arashiyama arrive at and depart from Platform 4, and during that time the trains of Kitano Line returning from this station use Platform 3.
sen.cmt: 京福のサイトに従い、Kitano-Hakubaichoとしました。Kitano Lineを追加しました。

sen.j: 桓武天皇皇子仲野親王高畠墓（6世紀の前方後円墳）
sen.e: The Imperial Mausoleum of prince Nakano, prince of Emperor Kanmu (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound built in the sixth century)
The mausoleum of Prince Nakano, prince of Emperor Kanmu (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound built in the sixth century)

sen.j: 蛇塚古墳（日本有数の巨大な横穴式石室が露出する6世紀の前方後円墳）
sen.e: Hebizuka (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound built in the sixth century, where an enoumous stone chamber dug into a hill side, one of the largest of its kind in Japan, is exposed)
Hebizuka (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound built in the sixth century, where an enormous stone chamber dug into a hill side--one of the largest of its kind in Japan--is exposed)
Hebizuka Tomb (a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound built in the sixth century, where an enormous stone chamber dug into a hill side--one of the largest of its kind in Japan--is exposed)

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）3月10日 嵐山電車軌道の駅として開業。
sen.e: March 25, 1910: This station started its operation as a station of Arashiyama Trams.
March 25, 1910: This station started operating as a facility of Arashiyama Trams.
March 10, 1926: This station started operating as a facility of Arashiyama Electric Tramway.
sen.cmt: 嵐山電車軌道→Arashiyama Electric Tramway としました。

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）4月2日 会社合併により京都電燈の駅となる。
sen.e: April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged and it became a station of the Kyoto Dento electric power company.
April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged, and it became a station of the Kyoto Dento electric power company.
April 2, 1918: The companies concerned merged, and it became a station of Kyoto Dento, an electric power company.
sen.cmt: 京都電燈→Kyoto Dento, an electric power company としました。

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）3月10日 北野線高雄口（現・宇多野）～帷子ノ辻間が開業。
sen.e: March 10, 1926: Tram operation between Takaoguchi Station (present Utano Station) on the Kitano Line and Katabiranotsuji Station started.
March 10, 1926: Tram operation started between Takaoguchi Station (the present-day Utano Station) on the Kitano Line and Katabiranotsuji Station.
March 10, 1926: Tram operation started between Takaoguchi Station (the present-day Utano Station) on the Kitano Line and Katabiranotsuji Station.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 路線継承により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a station of the company.
March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a facility of that company.
March 2, 1942: The tramway was transferred to Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and this station became a facility of that company.
